abstract_summ: Novel ways of online teaching should be considered in new medical curricula development, as well as methods of delivering practical skills for medical students online.COVID‐19 has disrupted medical education on an international scale with clinical attachments cancelled, assessments and teaching moved online, and numerous universities graduating their final year medical students early to assist pressured health systems.The COVID-19 pandemic has affected the delivery of medical education and has limited the ability of student parents to fully engage with their studies.As a result, several innovative educational projects and volunteering opportunities have been established to help care delivery and enhance remote medical education.This article described from the perspective of a medical student how the lack of practical teaching with cadavers can adversely impact training and lead to losses for students.
title_summ: PivotMedEd.comThe Impact of the Covid‐19 Pandemic on Current Anatomy Education and Future Careers: A Student’s Perspective#Med StudentCovid – How social media is supporting students during COVID‐19The impact of COVID-19 on the undergraduate medical curriculumChallenges in teaching human anatomy to students with intellectual disabilities during the Covid‐19 pandemicMedical education engagement during the COVID-19 era - A student parents perspective.Helping medical educators world‐wide pivot their curricula online:All Hands on Deck - Creation of an Online Internal Medicine Redeployment Curriculum.Medical Education During the COVID-19 Pandemic: A Single Institution Experience.
title_abstract_phrases: Novel ways of online teaching should be considered in new medical curricula development, as well as methods of delivering practical skills for medical students online.The Impact of the Covid‐19 Pandemic on Current Anatomy Education and Future Careers: A Student’s PerspectiveAs both an anatomy student and anatomy demonstrator, Anatomical Sciences Education has become my go-to journal to further my knowledge of the latest developments in anatomy education, innovations in pedagogical practice, and indeed perspectives on current affairs in the field.#Med StudentCovid – How social media is supporting students during COVID‐19COVID‐19 has disrupted medical education on an international scale with clinical attachments cancelled, assessments and teaching moved online, and numerous universities graduating their final year medical students early to assist pressured health systems.This article described from the perspective of a medical student how the lack of practical teaching with cadavers can adversely impact training and lead to losses for students.Medical education engagement during the COVID-19 era - A student parents perspective.It has been shown that medical students and qualified doctors are not adequately confident in their ability to assess and manage skin conditions, and many feel that their undergraduate dermatology teaching was not satisfactory.
